sub_title: Expert Inclusive Diversity in Education | Policy Advisor Equity, Diversity and Inclusion | Speaker & Trainer on Inclusion and Identity
summary:
Themes of experience:
Inclusive Diversity, Social Inclusion, Widening Participation, Teaching & Learning, Critical & Narrative Pedagogy, Multicultural Education, Leadership, Talent development, Yoga Instruction.

Academics: 
After having finished my Degree Religious Education (MA, Cum Laude) at the VU Amsterdam, I was granted as Junior Researcher at the international REDCo Research Project  that addressed ‘Religion in Education. A contribution to dialogue or a factor of conflict in transforming societies of European Countries.’   I continued my professional career at the VU Learning and Teaching Centre (Onderwijscentrum VU) as a Education Developer for the VU Transfer Program and as a Diversity Coordinator at the Summercourse VU. My field of expertise was fostered by ECHO, Center for Diversity Policy, where I was appointed as Program Manager and worked several years in an international community of Inclusive Diversity Professionals addressing equity, social inclusion, widening participation, access and success of underrepresented students in higher education institutions. My main focus was to develop Teacher Trainer Courses that addressed ‘Inclusive and Diversity Sensitivity Teaching and Learning Skills’ and training and coaching of inclusive leadership skills of (young) professionals in corporates industries in order to enhance the access and success of underrepresented students in corporate industries. After these inspiring years I started my own Training and Consulting Company in Inclusive Diversity, Younity Consultancy. I continued to develop my Teaching and Training Skills and Expertise by working with Narratives in Higher Education by means of the PhD Project I started simultaneously at the VU Amsterdam.  Currently I am hosting various project at Younity Consultancy and am finishing my PhD that presents a curriculum design of a critical, narrative and inclusive approach to learning and teaching in Higher Education Institutions.

Yoga & Pilates: see below

projects.title: Me-Treats. Recharging Body&Mind
projects.description: Een Body & Mind tweedaagse met de workshops: Yoga, Biografisch Interviewen, het Socratische Gesprek, Massage én verantwoord en heerlijk biologische voeding (met dankzij Juice Mechanic). Een Body & Mind Detox voor mentale en lichamelijke zelfzorg rondom het thema Ambitie.

projects.title: Train the Trainer Katholieke Universiteit Leuven
projects.description: Tijdens het Train-the-Trainer programma zijn medewerkers (studieadviseurs, docenten en diensthoofden) van de KUL getraind om workshops te kunnen faciliteren en studiebegeleiding te bieden die in het teken staan van identiteit en narratieven, gekoppeld aan de thematiek van studie(keuze). Doelstelling was om de expertise over te dragen die benodigd is om verhalen van eerste generatiestudenten (pioniers) adequaat te ontsluiten en in te zetten voor reflectie rondom studie(keuze), aspiratie en academische attitude. Activerende didactieken van het socratisch gesprek en het biografisch interview gaven de deelnemers een concrete vertaalslag van theoretische kennis over ‘werken met narratieven’ naar ‘narratieven ontsluiten en inzetten.’ Een afwisseling tussen kennis en kunde, gecombineerd met inspirerende getuigenissen van pioniers, maakte de training ‘zeer de moeite waard’ aldus een deelnemer.

profile_positions.title: Staffunctionaris Diversiteit en Inclusie, Hogeschool Rotterdam

profile_positions.description:
Gusta Tavecchio is trainer, onderwijsontwikkelaar en promovenda binnen YounityConsultancy.
Younity levert kennis & advies aan o.a. onderwijsinstellingen, bedrijven en overheden op het gebied van identiteit, diversiteit en inclusiviteit. Younity beschikt over een gevarieerd aanbod aan lezingen, workshops & trainingen naast het maatwerk dat zij biedt. Daarnaast ontwikkelt Younity lessenseries voor het primair, voortgezet en hoger onderwijs en voert deze uit. Op basis van de theoretische grondslagen van de Narratieve Pedagogiek en de thema’s Identiteit, Diversiteit en Inclusiviteit levert Younity op maat lessenseries, lesplannen en onderwijsproducten voor leerlingen, studenten, docenten, bestuur en ondersteunend personeel.
zie www.younityconsultancy.nl
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: Ever since my student days (2003), I teach Yoga and Pilates. These activities fostered an interest of mine to support participants in Yoga classes to be more aware of their mental and physical health. This field of interest has expanded over time and currently I am teaching several yoga styles (critical alignment yoga, hatha yoga, vinyasa yoga, hot yoga) and pilates and am integrating my educational learning and teaching skill in my KidsYoga classes that I particularly enjoy. These fusion workshops and retreats that I organize for families to enjoy parents & child yoga and for (young) professionals to enjoy work-life balance coaching retreats, give me the opportunity to share my insights and methods of working with narratives in order to reflect and become aware of patterns and choices in life that are worthwhile to take into consideration in order to take turn and defeat the (personal, career, mental) barriers that challenge participants in their daily life and routines. With this Body and Mind work I am personally continuously challenged by the on-going (physical) interaction between trainer and trainee, which I so much enjoy.
profile_positions.title: Yolates Company

profile_positions.description: For the Mentoring Urban Talent Research, a joint research program between the EUR and the VU is conducted. 4 schools in secondary education will participate in a mentoring program to prevents (underrepresented) students from 'downgrading.' As a education consultant, I am involved in the curriculum design of the mentoring tool and the qualitative execution of the research on mentoring.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.company: Erasmus+ | Onderwijs & Training, Jeugd en Sport
profile_positions.description: For the Erasmus+ program, I am responsible to create an inclusive outreach and support strategy to include all students and professionals to mobility and internationalisation in education
profile_positions.title: inclusion coordinator

profile_positions.description: In order to combat poor graduation rates and feelings of disenfranchisement and exclusion amongst minority and first-generation college/university students, universities have begun to offer Summer Bridge Programs at the their institutions in order to foster an environment of inclusivity and peer mentorship.  In this vein, my PhD describes a multiple case study of summer bridge programs created by the Vrije University in Amsterdam, the University of California, Los Angeles and Nevada State College in Las Vegas which encourage the academic success of underrepresented and first generation college/university students seeking to graduate from Higher Educational Institutions.  These programs provide students with some type of support in order to enroll in each program’s intensive summer program consisting of core university classes, while at the same time, supporting students with hands-on teaching, mind-set workshops, peer-mentorship programs, and tutoring.  The aim of this research is to support students in the discovery of both their voice and identity capital in order to encourage them to assert their agency.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Ella houdt van stipjes en van roze. Ze is verre familie van Zwelgje. Dan stort Ella’s roze stippen fort in en komt Zwelgje uit haar grot. Ella is 26 als ze een herseninfarct krijgt.
'T Kan Altijd Erger gaat over Zwelgje, roze stipjes, ziekenhuizen en prikjes en is het autobiografische boek dat ik (Gusta) schreef over een ingrijpende periode in mijn leven nadat ik een herseninfarct kreeg.
profile_positions.title: 'T Kan Altijd Erger

company.name: ECHO, Expertise center for Diversity Policy

profile_positions.description: Gusta has worked for ECHO as a Program Manager for two years. ECHO works on the development of policy to manage cultural diversity in organizations. From the acquired expertise in higher education, ECHO positions itself by focussing on new opportunities for developments. ECHO provides advice and training to manage the end to end process in relation to diversity policy together with our clients. Furthermore ECHO challenges herself to change the negative image of ethnic minorities by revealing their talent.(www.echo-net.nl)
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description: Gusta has worked at the Free University Amsterdam for 5 years as a researcher in the field of Religious Education, policy maker, and coordinator in the field of Diversity and Study Success.
profile_positions.title: coordinator in the field of diversity and study success

profile_positions.description: As a junior researcher I was involved in editing academic articles into academic journals and conducting and transcribing interviews. Subsequently, I had to report about the preliminary findings concerning these interviews. Furthermore, I was encouraged to write a research proposal, which lead to my current PhD project.
profile_positions.title: junior researcher
